longDef.en: the skill or activity of getting information from books

examples.en: Reading and tennis are my favourite pastimes.
examples.cn: 我最喜欢的业余爱好就是读书和打网球。

examples.en: The diaries make good (bedtime) reading (= are good to read (in bed at night)).
examples.cn: （睡前在床上）读一读这些日记是很好的消遣。

examples.en: These books are compulsory/required reading for students of architecture.
examples.cn: 这些是主修建筑学的学生的必读书目。

longDef.en: an occasion when something written, especially a work of literature, is spoken to an audience
longDef.cn: （尤指文学著作的）读书会，朗诵会

examples.en: The society often arranges poetry readings and musical evenings.
examples.cn: 该社团经常筹划诗歌朗诵会和音乐晚会。

longDef.en: the way in which you understand something
longDef.cn: 理解方法;解读方法;解释

examples.en: My reading of the situation is that John wanted any excuse to resign.
examples.cn: 我对形势的看法是，约翰正在寻找理由辞职。

longDef.en: In a parliament, a reading of a new law is one of the stages of discussion before it is approved
longDef.cn: （议会批准新法律前的）宣读;（新法律在议会三读阶段中的任何）一读

examples.en: The Housing Bill was given its second reading in Parliament today.
examples.cn: 住宅法案今天在议会进行二读。

longDef.en: the number or amount that a piece of measuring equipment shows
longDef.cn: 读数（一件测量设备所显示的数字或量值）
